accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records more than 10 years old are open for research, unless otherwise noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Consists primarily of program files, staff meeting files and administrative records.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in collections by file type or originating officer. Additional finding aids are created as records are processed and open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Between 1990 and 1995, the Ford Foundation's Reproductive Health and Population (RHP) program provided grants to organizations devoted to assisting disadvantaged women in developing nations and adolescents in rural and urban areas in three general categories: strengthening social science research; enabling women and their partners to be more directly involved in the design and implementation of reproductive health programs and policies; and promoting discussion of religious and ethical values related to reproductive behavior. Grants also supported programs to prevent sexually transmitted diseases, promote children's developmental health, improve reproductive health services, and prevent pregnancy related disability and death.
